DOC.HEADLINE: TWO OFFICERS SERIOUSLY INJURED RETURNING TO SAFETY CLASS

TEXT.P: Two police officers returning to a motorcycle safety class crashed their bikes into one another west of Denver Thursday afternoon and were seriously hurt.

The officers -- one from Lafayette, the other from Northglenn, two cities north of Denver -- were thrown from their motorcycles when one bike clipped the other as a group of more than 30 motorcycle cops were getting onto Colorado-470 in Jefferson County about 12:30 p.m., according to the Colorado State Patrol.
The officers, who have not been named, received serious but non-life-threatening injuries, said Trooper Heather Cobbler.
Neither officer was cited, but the collision remains under investigation, she said. The crash temporarily closed the highway.
Thirty-three officers were taking part in a weeklong motorcycle-training school for advanced riders at Bandimere Speedway in Morrison.
"They are all experienced riders," said Jefferson County Sheriff's spokesman Mark Techmeyer.
